She was born, and raised for part of her early life, in Bradford, and studied at the Bradford Girls' Grammar School before briefly attending the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. She withdrew from LAMDA to focus on her musical career.

people.name: Natalia Kills
people.aboutText:
Maria Fowler (born 15 August 1986) is an English glamour model and Page 3 Girl. Fowler has been featured in UK and Worldwide publications Fowler had a supporting role in ITV2 series The Only Way Is Essex from 2010–11.
Fowler was born as Maria Catherine Fowler and brought up in Derby, England.

people.name: Besik Kudukhov
people.aboutText:
Besik Serodinovich Kudukhov (Russian: Бесик Серoдинович Кудухов; 15 August 1986 – 29 December 2013) was a Russian freestyle wrestler of Ossetian descent. At the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing, he won bronze in his category (55 kg).
Kudukhov was born in Tskhilon, Georgia.

people.name: Michel Kreder
people.aboutText: Michel Kreder (born 15 August 1987) is a Dutch professional racing cyclist who rides for Roompot–Oranje Peloton. His cousin Wesley, also rides for Roompot–Oranje Peloton, as does his younger brother Raymond. Following a four-year stint with Garmin–Sharp, Kreder signed with Wanty–Groupe Gobert for the 2014 and 2015 seasons.

people.name: Sean McAllister
people.aboutText:
Sean Brian McAllister (born 15 August 1987) is an English footballer who plays as a midfielder for League One side Scunthorpe United.
Primarily as a central midfielder, he has good vision and passing ability. He began his professional career at Sheffield Wednesday in 2006, and had spells on loan at Mansfield Town and Bury, before establishing himself in the "Owls" first team in the 2008–09 season.

people.name: Ryan D'Imperio
people.aboutText: Ryan D'Imperio (born August 15, 1987) is a former American football fullback. He was drafted by the Minnesota Vikings with the 237th overall pick in the seventh round of the 2010 NFL Draft.

people.name: Oussama Assaidi
people.aboutText:
Oussama Assaidi (Arabic: أسامة السعيدي‎, Tamazight : Ušama Ašaidi; born 15 August 1988) is a Moroccan footballer who plays as a winger for Al-Ahli Dubai, and the Moroccan national team.
Assaidi began his career in the Netherlands with AZ Alkmaar. After failing to earn a contract with AZ he played with second tier club FC Omniworld and then De Graafschap before joining Heerenveen in 2009.

people.name: Zaira Nara
people.aboutText:
Zaira Nara (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈsaiɾa ˈnaɾa]; born 15 August 1988 in Boulogne Sur Mer, Argentina) is an Argentine model and TV host, and sister of Wanda Nara. In 2010, according to FHM magazine, she was ranked 47 of the world's sexiest women in 2010.
Nara has modelled for brands such as Herbal Essences, McDonald's, La Serenísima, Gillette, Pantene and Falabella.

people.name: Ryan McGowan
people.aboutText: Ryan James McGowan (born 15 August 1989) is an Australian football (soccer) player who plays for Dundee United in the Scottish Premiership, as a defender. He has previously played for Para Hills Knights, Heart of Midlothian and Shandong Luneng Taishan, with loan spells at Ayr United and Partick Thistle. McGowan has represented Australia at U-17, U-20, U-23 and at full international level.

people.name: Joe Jonas
people.aboutText: Joseph Adam "Joe" Jonas (born August 15, 1989) is an American singer and actor. Jonas first rose to fame as a member of the pop-rock band Jonas Brothers, along with this brothers Kevin and Nick. The band's debut album, It's About Time (2006), was a commercial failure following a limited release.

people.name: Kristina Karjalainen
people.aboutText: Carlos Roberto PenaVega (né Pena, Jr.; born August 15, 1989) is an American actor and singer. He is best known for starring on the Nickelodeon series Big Time Rush as Carlos García in addition to being a member of the band Big Time Rush.

people.name: Carlos Pena, Jr.
people.aboutText:
Kristina Karjalainen (born 15 August 1989 in Tallinn) is an Estonian-Finnish beauty queen who won Eesti Miss Estonia 2013 and represented Estonia at the Miss Universe 2013 pageant.
^ "Eesti Miss Estonia 2013 is Kristina from Tallinn". globalbeauties.com.

people.name: Belinda Peregrín
people.aboutText: Belinda Peregrín Schüll, known mononymously as Belinda (born 15 August 1989) is a Spanish-born Mexican  singer-songwriter. She started her career as a child actor at the age of 10 when she was cast as the lead role in the children's telenovela ¡Amigos X Siempre! (2000).

people.name: Nyusha
people.aboutText: Anna Vladimirovna Shurochkina (Russian: Анна Владимировна Шурочкина, born 15 August 1990), better known by her stage name Nyusha (Ню́ша) is a Russian singer-songwriter.

people.name: Aglaja Brix
people.aboutText: Jennifer Shrader Lawrence (born August 15, 1990) is an American actress. She has received an Academy Award and three Golden Globe Awards. Lawrence began her career in television, playing her first major role as a lead cast member on the TBS sitcom The Bill Engvall Show (2007–09).

people.name: Jennifer Lawrence
people.aboutText: Aglaja Brix (born August 15, 1990) is a German actress.

people.name: Toomas Raadik
people.aboutText: Toomas Raadik (born August 15, 1990) is an Estonian professional basketball player. He currently plays for TTÜ KK. His position is power forward. He started his career in KK Pärnu.

people.name: Danny Verbeek
people.aboutText: Danny Verbeek (born 15 August 1990 in Den Bosch) is a Dutch professional footballer who currently plays as a winger for NAC Breda in the Dutch Eerste Divisie. He formerly played for FC Den Bosch, Standard Liège and NAC Breda.

people.name: Petja Piiroinen
people.aboutText: Petja Piiroinen (born August 15, 1991) is a snowboarder from Finland. He won the gold medal at the 2011 FIS Snowboarding World Championships in the big air event. He is the younger brother of fellow snowboarder Peetu Piiroinen.

people.name: Baskaran Adhiban
people.aboutText:
Baskaran Adhiban (born 15 August 1992 in Mayiladuthurai) is an Indian chess Grandmaster. He was the 2008 World Under-16 Champion and the 2009 Indian champion.
He played on the first board for the gold medal-winning Indian team at the Under-16 Chess Olympiad of 2008.

people.name: Clinton N'Jie
people.aboutText:
Alexander Mark David "Alex" Oxlade-Chamberlain /ˌɒksleɪd ˈtʃeɪmbərlɪn/ (born 15 August 1993) is an English professional footballer who plays as a winger for Premier League club Arsenal and the England national team.
After rising to prominence with Southampton during the 2010–11 season aged 17, he signed for Arsenal in August 2011. Scoring twice in his first three games for the club, Oxlade-Chamberlain became the youngest English goal scorer in UEFA Champions League history and has also claimed a regular place in the England Under-21s team.

people.name: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain
people.aboutText: Clinton Mua N'Jie (born 15 August 1993) is a Cameroonian professional footballer who currently plays for Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur and the Cameroon national team.

people.name: Lasse Vigen Christensen
people.aboutText: Alice Allegra Englert (born 15 June 1994) is an Australian-born actress best known for her roles as Rosa in the film Ginger & Rosa, and as Lena Duchannes in the 2013 film Beautiful Creatures.

people.name: Alice Englert
people.aboutText: Lasse Vigen Christensen (born 15 August 1994) is a Danish professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for English club Fulham.

people.name: Kosuke Hagino
people.aboutText: Natalja Aleksandrovna Zabijako (Russian: Наталья Александровна Забияко, born 15 August 1994) is a Russian-Estonian pair skater. She competed for Estonia until 2014, partnered with Sergei Muhhin, Sergei Kulbach, and Alexandr Zaboev. With Zaboev, she placed tenth at the 2014 European Championships.

people.name: Natalja Zabijako
people.aboutText: Kosuke Hagino (萩野公介, Hagino Kōsuke, born 15 August 1994) is a Japanese swimmer who specializes in the individual medley and 200 freestyle. He had the best time in the 400m individual medley heats at the 2012 Summer Olympics with a time of 4:10.01, an Asian record. He went on to claim the bronze medal in the final, placing third behind gold medalist Ryan Lochte of the United States and silver medalist Thiago Pereira of Brazil.

people.name: Chief Keef
people.aboutText: Yui Ogura (小倉 唯, Ogura Yui, born August 15, 1995 in Midori, Gunma) is a Japanese voice actress, pop idol, singer, and actress. She is a member of the idol duo YuiKaori with Kaori Ishihara and was part of the idol unit StylipS (also with Kaori, along with Arisa Noto and Maho Matsunaga). She was also part of the Japanese pop group Happy!

people.name: Yui Ogura
people.aboutText: Keith Cozart (born August 15, 1995), better known by his stage name Chief Keef, is an American rapper and record producer from Chicago, Illinois. Growing up in Chicago's Englewood neighborhood, Keef began rapping at an early age, and used his mother's karaoke machine and blank tapes to record his music. During his teenage years and while under house arrest, Keef's music videos were met with acclaim from local high school students.
